text:
tube towards your uterus. 
It begins as one single cell, 
which divides again and again. 
By the time the fertilised egg 
reaches your uterus, it has 
become a mass of over 100 
cells, called an embryo. It is still 
growing. Once in your uterus, 
the embryo attaches itself into 
your uterus lining. This is called 
implantation.
